body:
> Hey can i work on this?

Yes, assigned to you.
Welcome @shreya024.

> Hi @strongduanmu, I checked locally, the build passed for the command `mvn clean install -Prelease`. I'm not sure where the error comes from.
> 
> ![shardingsphere-build-results](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48581379/158823368-08528207-4e14-4e2b-9d6e-afab40b31a6f.png)

@ThanoshanMV The ci error is not caused by this pr, it has been fixed in the master branch.
Hi @yx9o , some CI tasks failed, please check them.
@Swastyy You are so attentive, but the blog of the historical version cannot be modified. So I just close this issue.
Thanks for your answer, but the maven central repository cannot find the sharding-jdbc-spring-boot-starter 5x version.  do I need to specify the warehouse address. @TeslaCN
I found it, the original artifactId changed. thanks

CI test for JDK 8 - on macos-latest is showing error in a different test file
DataSourcePoolDestroyerTest.assertAsyncDestroyHikariDataSource:40->createHikariDataSource:57 » TestTimedOut

> @LGAKing Please refer to : https://github.com/apache/shardingsphere/tree/master/examples/shardingsphere-jdbc-example/single-feature-example/transaction-example

Thanks! But what I want is an example of XA mode based on shardingsphere and seata

Hi @huyu-tom , thanks for your feedback. Could you get a workaround for now?

> in SingletonSPIRegistry, getSingletonInstancesMap will register SPI, but TypedSPIRegistry not. Manual registration is required when using TypedSPIRegistry, but not when using SingletonSPIRegistry. unify behavior?

Hi @SirMin , `SingletonSPI` and `SingletonSPIRegistry` were added after `TypedSPIRegistry` to simplify singleton SPI  usage and improve performance. And `getSingletonInstancesMap` method should be called once for one `singletonSPIClass`, so it's equavalent as before.

But methods in `TypedSPIRegistry` will be called repeatedly for one `typedSPIClass`, if we add `ShardingSphereServiceLoader.register(...)` in `TypedSPIRegistry` methods, it'll be called too much times, so it's not added for now.

In fact, only `ShardingSphereServiceLoader.getSingletonServiceInstances` were replaced as `SingletonSPIRegistry`, there might be more cases could be improved later.

Hi @galaxylqx , What's the advantages if we do data source aggregation? Save opened connections?
It's true in some cases, but we could consider the most connections we need for peak throughput, the connections counts are similar in this case, no matter we do data source aggregation or not. And we could do some optimization on data source configuration to take similar effect.
